lexUnit.name: repentance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a feeling or expression of sincere regret

sentence.text: It is God who rejoices at the repentance of a sinner , just as the father rejoices at the return of the prodigal son .
Not in public , at least , if you make a thorough job of your repentance .
The victims attended the feast after Drachenfels ' feigned repentance convinced the wisest and best that he had truly turned from evil .
His sentence , of four years in prison with one year 's deprivation of political rights , took into consideration his repentance and his assistance in " exposing " others , the court said .
She looked up at Phoebe with an anguished expression that was nearly honest repentance .
I am too old now to play at any mock repentance . "
Personal misfortune was regarded either as a test of faith which had to be patiently endured , or as a punishment for past transgressions requiring deep repentance .
Even at his worst , he implies that he never transcended the ultimate standards of gentlemanly conduct and human decency , or at least never did so without sincere repentance .
This was in order to ` convince him of his misery and the necessity of true repentance and reformation " .
They were encouraged to profess repentance and contrition which in the view of CD and others simply promoted hypocrisy , hence his satire on ` Model Prisoners " in DC 61 .
Her hope is that ` by enabling insight , they may inspire repentance " .
You have n't shown any repentance . "
The official news agency , Xinhua , stated that he had been released because he had shown repentance .
It was the middle-class , and especially Dissenters and Evangelicals , who wrote regular diaries as an aid to daily reviews of conduct and repentance for sin .
Yet even after all the disobedience , God still promises to respond to the call of genuine repentance .

After that he announced his repentance at the mosque twice in front of Albu'Ubaid tribe , denouncing who joins the police and army , and sorry for all he 's done , without any pressure or threats from the brothers .
